definition: to seize/to push aside and occupy
to crowd in/to cram in/to force others aside/to press/to squeeze/to find (time in one's busy schedule)
to take possession of/to occupy/to take up

sentences.english: When we had a billion people, you said we were destroying the planet.
sentences.chinese: 我们拥有数十亿人民，你说我们挤占地球。

sentences.english: As a result, other species are running out of places to live.
sentences.chinese: 结果是其他物种的生存空间正被人类挤占殆尽。

sentences.english: Special funds diverted in serious condition, too many unreasonable expenditures.
sentences.chinese: 挤占专项经费情况严重，不合理支出太多。

sentences.english: Live broadcast of the presidential debate preempts the regular news hour.
sentences.chinese: 总统辩论的现场广播挤占了常规的新闻时间。

sentences.english: Shops cram into every available space.
sentences.chinese: 商店挤占了每一个可用的空间。

definition: lit. pulling on the lapels exposes the elbows (idiom)/strapped for cash/unable to make ends meet
to fill a gap/to fill in a blank (on a form)/to overcome a deficiency
lit. many monks and not much gruel (idiom)/fig. not enough to go around/demand exceeds supply
to make (some time or space) available (for sb)
